processedVideos.transcriptText:
"A Practical Guide To Squad And Setting-Up Drill" is drill instruction manual that was written by Bertram Browne,  in 1871.

It was designed for newly recruited soldiers, with exercises designed to improve strength and mobility of the upper limbs, posture and of course, teach discipline.

After the introduction, Thierry demonstrates the military Indian clubs exercises from the book, as he understood them.

➡ How and why the Brits adopted the Indian clubs

➡ The different designs of Indian clubs

➡ Indian club swinging vs British club swinging

➡ Military stance and the lack of it in some of the old books

Looking at club swinging in that way, he also raises some questions. If you have answers, we'd love you to join in the discussion in the comments!

Conor Heffernan has published academic research about Indian clubs, and is currently working an assistant Professor in Physical Culture and Sport Studies (Department of Kinesiology and Health Education) at the University of Texas.

Indian clubs used in this video

Step by step tutorials & programs

What can Indian clubs do for you?

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport| An ancient discipline

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ Ready to learn more?

All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

Best regards from Thierry & Ron

# [Real military Indian club exercises from 1871](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Nn6Z8oq4cI)

**Visibility**: Public
**Uploaded by**: [Heroic Sport - Indian clubs workouts](http://www.youtube.com/@HeroicSport)
**Uploaded at**: 2020-03-13T03:00:12-07:00
**Published at**: 2020-03-13T03:00:12-07:00
**Length**: 21:33
**Views**: 14445
**Likes**: 335
**Category**: Sports

## Description

```
"A Practical Guide To Squad And Setting-Up Drill" is drill instruction manual that was written by Bertram Browne,  in 1871.
It was designed for newly recruited soldiers, with exercises designed to improve strength and mobility of the upper limbs, posture and of course, teach discipline. 
You can read the book here: https://bit.ly/2wGvZzq

After the introduction, Thierry demonstrates the military Indian clubs exercises from the book, as he understood them.  
He then goes on to talk about:
➡ How and why the Brits adopted the Indian clubs
➡ The different designs of Indian clubs 
➡ Indian club swinging vs British club swinging
➡ Military stance and the lack of it in some of the old books
➡ Training guidelines
Looking at club swinging in that way, he also raises some questions. If you have answers, we'd love you to join in the discussion in the comments!

Conor Heffernan has published academic research about Indian clubs, and is currently working an assistant Professor in Physical Culture and Sport Studies (Department of Kinesiology and Health Education) at the University of Texas.
Check out more of Conor's writing about Indian clubs  on his website: https://physicalculturestudy.com/?s=indian+clubs
Or follow him on Twitter: https://twitter.com/PhysCstudy

HEMA TRAINING PROGRAMS: https://heroicsport.com/product-category/indian-clubs-education/indian-clubs-for-hema/
---
Indian clubs used in this video
Pahlavande original ☛ https://heroicsport.com/product/pahlavandle-indian-clubs-handles/
See all our handcrafted Indian clubs ☛ https://heroicsport.com/product-category/buy-indian-clubs-for-sale/ 
⚜️ Promo code: gen9 ⚜️ 10% off Pahlavandle original when not on sale
---
Step by step tutorials & programs
https://heroicsport.com/product-category/indian-clubs-education/
⚜️ Promo code: swing101 ⚜️ 20% off all programs when not on sale
---
What can Indian clubs do for you?
Watch this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ft-FL_6s_No

❂ Physical benefits
Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion
Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion
Consists of compound movements in multiple planes
Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise
Assists recovery from intense training
Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

❂ Mental benefits
It is fun and you forget you are training.
The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.
Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport| An ancient discipline 
We have created the Pahlavandle ™ range to make it affordable for everyone to discover the benefits of swinging clubs.
Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers. 
Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ Ready to learn more?
We run instructor certifications (online and live), team building events and offer video downloads on our website at https://heroicsport.com/indian-clubs-online/ 
All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

Best regards from Thierry & Ron
```

especially about the military side of club swinging get in touch with us leave a comment below paulo vandal from heroic sport exercise wherever whenever reboot your mind and body

processedVideos.transcriptText:
In this lesson, we combine basic elements from lessons 2 & 3 to create 2 simple choreographed routines you can repeat ad lib, until you are ready to unleash your own creativity and flow with the clubs.

What can Indian clubs do for you?

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport | An ancient discipline

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

Circle so that's one two is the right boom three is the front Circle four is the right now both clubs are going to fall to the left then to the right so we've done a figure eight then by the side of the legs I'm going to step forward catch the clubs into my swipe lunge from here I'm going to extend the arms forward okay come back step back into the back swing switch the legs look up extend the arms straight ahead backswing swipe and here we're going out wide we close and we're back to the start so we've got one two three and four five six seven eight nine ten eleven twelve thirteen fourteen fifteen sixteen seventeen 18. now it's possible for you to add again extra wrist circles along the way when you feel comfortable and build up from that routine with the new swings that we you will swinging to the left stepping back with the right pull the bar open boom stand up flag front press boom swing to the left step with the left whoo boom front press from here I'm going to swing low and do a return like a little dead stop side to side so I'm going to step right one two three moving in opposition and coming back to the center from here across my clubs catch into an overhead squat processedVideos.transcriptText:
We made this kettlebell juggling tutorials to help you understand the difference between swinging kettlebells for girevoy sport or hardstyle, and juggling.

Learn how to properly release the kettlebell before attempting a spin, and how to move with the kettlebell.

Variations include single and double kettlebell juggling exercises.

Kettlebells go hand in hand with Indian clubs!

Step by step tutorials & programs

What can Indian clubs do for you?

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport| An ancient discipline

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ Ready to learn more?

All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

Best regards from Thierry & Ron

this video is going to be about kelvil juggling so I'm going to show you a few progressions on how to do the different flips and and a few tips you can use to improve your Kel belt juggling so to make it easiest to catch the handle again when you make it flip you have to make sure that when you let go of the handle it's really in a neutral position so the handle is not at an angle the flip through the air gonna make it impossible to catch again so make sure that you release the kettlebell with the handle neutral parallel to the ground or perpendicular to the ground the next thing is that when you release the quelle Belle and make it flip you don't just want to make it describe a big movement right through the air through space you wanna make sure that that quelle Belle becomes weightless and spins on its own axis staying at the same height in the same distance from your body the swings are gonna use when you're juggling with Kelly bells it's quite different from a fitness swing or swing when you try to accelerate as much as possible here it's more kind of relaxed tempo and you're my swing in a different slightly different style that you usually do with the basic flips you have different progression options too to get family to throwing and catching again so it's going to be with two hands on the Cal bear then one hand then hand to hand and then eventually can also have one killer Belle in each hand the last thing when you're doing quelle Belle juggling and tricks it's also important to be uncomfortable with moving around and with the cowbell so it's good idea to # [Kettlebell juggling tutorial with slow motion | Simple to complex tricks](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v2G44RFpY1s)

**Visibility**: Public
**Uploaded by**: [Heroic Sport - Indian clubs workouts](http://www.youtube.com/@HeroicSport)
**Uploaded at**: 2019-11-05T15:00:11-08:00
**Published at**: 2019-11-05T15:00:11-08:00
**Length**: 08:58
**Views**: 10220
**Likes**: 372
**Category**: Sports

## Description

```
We made this kettlebell juggling tutorials to help you understand the difference between swinging kettlebells for girevoy sport or hardstyle, and juggling.

Learn how to properly release the kettlebell before attempting a spin, and how to move with the kettlebell. 
Variations include single and double kettlebell juggling exercises.

Kettlebells go hand in hand with Indian clubs! 
See how you can get a feel for circular training here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LyLM493QVI8

See all our handcrafted Indian clubs ☛ https://heroicsport.com/product-category/buy-indian-clubs-for-sale/ 
⚜️ Promo code: gen9 ⚜️ 10% off Pahlavandle original when not on sale
---
Step by step tutorials & programs
https://heroicsport.com/product-category/indian-clubs-education/
⚜️ Promo code: swing101 ⚜️ 20% off all programs when not on sale
---
⏰TIMESTAMPS⏰
0:00 Intro, grips , safety
1:46 H2H walking swing
2:16 Backward flips
2:56 Forward flips
3:40 Double KB flips
4:06 Helicopter flips
4:39 Hammer grip flips
5:12 Overhead flips
5:33 Under the hip flips
6:02 Over the shoulder flips
6:23 Side to side flips
7:16 Open palm catch
8:04 Spins

---
What can Indian clubs do for you?
Watch this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ft-FL_6s_No

❂ Physical benefits
Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion
Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion
Consists of compound movements in multiple planes
Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise
Assists recovery from intense training
Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

❂ Mental benefits
It is fun and you forget you are training.
The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.
Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport| An ancient discipline 
We have created the Pahlavandle ™ range to make it affordable for everyone to discover the benefits of swinging clubs.
Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers. 
Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ Ready to learn more?
We run instructor certifications (online and live), team building events and offer video downloads on our website at https://heroicsport.com/indian-clubs-online/ 
All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

Best regards from Thierry & Ron
```
